events.comment: First version: use the action to send a request. Note that this is a GET request, but you could use "POST" or other methods and also send information in the body (typically, some JSON).
This second version is the same, but using JavaScript "fetch" method to send a request. As it's asynchronous, you must use "then()" and "catch()" to do work once the request is finished.

inlineCode: // The result can be converted from a JSON string (result) into a variable
// with `fromJSON`, which is a method available on variables:

events.comment:
Third version: this is the same as the first one, but the variable, request and JSON conversion was moved into a custom action inside an action.
This is useful to keep your events sheet very clean.
Display the result on screen, whatever the way the person was loaded from the API:

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

eventsFunctions.fullName: Request a random Star Wars person
eventsFunctions.name: GetRandomPerson
eventsFunctions.sentence: Send a request for a random Star Wars person and store it in _PARAM1_ (and error in _PARAM2_ if any)

events.comment:
This sends the request for a random person, then convert the JSON returned into a structure.

Finally, the structure (and the error, if any was returned) are copied back to the variables passed as parameter.

This action is "asynchronous", so we mark it as finished at the end.
